meanings.definition: The quality or state of being hoky.
meanings.sent1: The hokinesses of the movie made it hard to take seriously.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't help but laugh at the hokinesses of the magician's performance.
meanings.sent3: The hokinesses of the situation added a touch of humor to the otherwise serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was filled with hokinesses that left the audience rolling their eyes.
meanings.sent5: The hokinesses of the old play made it a memorable experience for the audience.

meanings.sent1: His constant hokinesses annoyed everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: The hokinesses of his jokes always brought a smile to people's faces.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't resist joining in the hokinesses of the game.
meanings.sent4: The politician's hokinesses were evident in his exaggerated gestures.
meanings.sent5: The children's playful hokinesses brightened up the room.

meanings.sent1: The hokinesses of the costume party made it a fun event for everyone.
meanings.sent2: I appreciated the hokinesses of the comedy show; it was light-hearted and enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: The hokinesses of his charm won over the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her hokinesses shone through in her quirky sense of humor.
meanings.sent5: The hokinesses of the painting gave it a unique and whimsical touch.
